message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a chance to purchase my product. I believe it would be incredibly valuable to your business.  I'm initially proposing a price of $1,800,000.  I'm open to discussing this further, so please let me know your thoughts.

Thank you for offering the product, Alice. I appreciate the value it might bring to my business. However, given my budget constraints, I am unable to meet the proposed price of $1,800,000. I am willing to pay up to $1,200,000 for the product. I hope this aligns better with your expectations.

Bob, I appreciate you getting back to me and acknowledging the value of the product.  While $1,800,000 represents a fair valuation, I understand your constraints. To move this forward, I'm willing to come down to $1,600,000.  I believe this price point reflects the product's worth while still offering you significant value.

Hello Alice, thank you for adjusting your offer. I appreciate your flexibility. Given my current financial situation, I am willing to consider a price closer to my maximum limit. Would $1,400,000 be acceptable for the product?
